name: How effective are TikTok misinformation debunking videos?
description: This dataset, sourced from Harvard Dataverse for the purpose of replication, contains information related to respondent demographics, political affiliation, attitudes toward specific topics, TikTok usage, and responses to specific questions relating to topics of misinformation.
funder: Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada, The John Templeton Foundation, Government of Canada’s Digital Citizen Contribution Program, U.S. Department of Defense

variableMeasured.name: responseid
variableMeasured.description: Subject ID

variableMeasured.name: age
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: age

variableMeasured.name: demrepc
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: political affiliation

variableMeasured.name: screener2acc
variableMeasured.description: Average attention accuracy in 2nd screener

variableMeasured.name: screener3acc
variableMeasured.description: Average attention accuracy in 3rd screener

variableMeasured.name: screenacc
variableMeasured.description: Average attention accuracy in 1st screener

variableMeasured.name: condition
variableMeasured.description: Whether participants saw correction-only video, misinformation-only video, or both

variableMeasured.name: counterbalance
variableMeasured.description: Whether false or true video was first

variableMeasured.name: education
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: education level

variableMeasured.name: aspartame
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: Aspartame toxicity (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))

variableMeasured.name: asymptomatic
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: COVID-19 asymptomatic transmission (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))agreement)

variableMeasured.name: rust
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: Rust film set shooting (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))

variableMeasured.name: herd
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: COVID-19 herd immunity (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))

variableMeasured.name: ivermectin
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: Ivermectin COVID-19 treatment (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))

variableMeasured.name: brain
variableMeasured.description: Agreement measure with a misinformative statement on topic: Left or right brain personality traits (using Likert scale from 1 (“Strongly disagree”) to 7 (“Strongly agree”))

variableMeasured.name: tiktok
variableMeasured.description: Participant has or does not have TikTok

variableMeasured.name: tiktokuse
variableMeasured.description: If participant has TikTok, self-reporting on TikTok usage

variableMeasured.name: tiktokrelativeuse
variableMeasured.description: If participant has TikTok, usage relative to other users

variableMeasured.name: number
variableMeasured.description: ID number

variableMeasured.name: group
variableMeasured.description: Assigned number for control, game-based, graphics-based groups (1-3)

variableMeasured.name: fake_dis_pre
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines pre-test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: fake_shar_pre
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines pre-test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_dis_pre
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines pre-test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_shar_pre
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines pre-test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: fake_dis_post
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines post-test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: fake_shar_post
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines post-test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_dis_post
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines post-test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_shar_post
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines post-test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: fake_dis_follow
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines follow-up test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: fake_shar_folow
variableMeasured.description: Fake headlines follow-up test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_dis_follow
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines follow-up test credibility score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: real_shar_folow
variableMeasured.description: Real headlines follow-up test willingness to share score using Likert scale (1 = totally not accurate, 5 = very accurate)

variableMeasured.name: gender
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: gender

variableMeasured.name: Region
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: region (1-29 for each Chinese province represented in study)

variableMeasured.name: RCT
variableMeasured.description: Cognitive ability score

variableMeasured.name: media literacy
variableMeasured.description: Media literacy score

variableMeasured.name: Session.ID
variableMeasured.description: Unique session ID number (duplicate)

variableMeasured.description: Unique session ID number

variableMeasured.name: treatment
variableMeasured.description: Participant Indicated Political Ideology

variableMeasured.name: EducationPretest
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: Education level

variableMeasured.name: GenderPretest
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: Gender

variableMeasured.description: Demographic: Age

variableMeasured.name: PoliticalIdeologyPretest
variableMeasured.description: Demographic: Political Ideology

variableMeasured.name: LCred
variableMeasured.description: Perceived credibility of liberal source

variableMeasured.name: RCred
variableMeasured.description: Perceived credibility of conservative source

variableMeasured.name: RSlant
variableMeasured.description: Perceived slant of conservative source

variableMeasured.name: LSlant
variableMeasured.description: Perceived slant of liberal source

variableMeasured.name: LeftCredCat
variableMeasured.description: Credibility category of liberal sources as high, low, or NA

variableMeasured.name: RightCredCat
variableMeasured.description: Credibility category of conservative sources as high, low, or NA

variableMeasured.name: RExtremity
variableMeasured.description: Conservative extreme headline scores

variableMeasured.name: LExtremity
variableMeasured.description: Liberal extreme headlines scores

variableMeasured.name: RSlantCategory
variableMeasured.description: Category of headlines' slant as left, right, neutral, or NA

variableMeasured.name: LSlantCategory
variableMeasured.description: Category of headlines' slant as left, right, neutral, or NA

variableMeasured.name: Dif
variableMeasured.description: Conservative-Liberal extremes difference

variableMeasured.name: ExtremityCategoryL
variableMeasured.description: Liberal extreme category identification as extreme, moderate, neutral, or NA

variableMeasured.name: ExtremityCategoryR
variableMeasured.description: Conservative extreme category identification as extreme, moderate, neutral, or NA

variableMeasured.name: Group
variableMeasured.description: Assignment of group as ingroup, outgroup, neither, or NA based on political affiliation

variableMeasured.name: PerceivedGroupR
variableMeasured.description: Perception of right-leaning source as ingroup, outgroup, or neither based on political affiliation

variableMeasured.name: PerceivedGroupL
variableMeasured.description: Perception of left-leaning source as ingroup, outgroup, or neither based on political affiliation

variableMeasured.name: PerceivedGroup
variableMeasured.description: Perception of group as ingroup, outgroup, control, or neither based on political affiliation

variableMeasured.name: PerceivedGroupFake
variableMeasured.description: Perception of group as ingroup, outgroup, control, or neither based on political affiliation
